meanings.definition: To make sudden, repetitive movements or sounds
meanings.sent1: She was ticcing nervously during the exam.
meanings.sent2: He often starts ticcing when he's excited.
meanings.sent3: The kitten was ticcing playfully with a ball of yarn.
meanings.sent4: The wind was ticcing the leaves off the trees.
meanings.sent5: The drummer's hands were ticcing rapidly on the drums.

meanings.definition: The act of making sudden, repetitive movements or sounds
meanings.sent1: His ticcing was noticeable in the quiet room.
meanings.sent2: The ticcing of the clock echoed through the hallway.
meanings.sent3: The audience found the comedian's ticcing hilarious.
meanings.sent4: The ticcing of the typewriter filled the office with rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The ticcing of the old engine signaled its struggle to start.
